meanings.def: feeling happy because something unpleasant has stopped or has not happened; showing this
examples: relieved to see, hear, find, etc. something You'll be relieved to know your jobs are safe.
relieved (that)… I'm just relieved that nobody was hurt.
He was clearly relieved when we offered to pay for the damage.
She was glad when the meeting was over.
We are happy to announce the engagement of our daughter.
She was very pleased with her exam results.
He was proud of himself for not giving up.
You’ll be relieved to know your jobs are safe.
I was thrilled to be invited.
I was secretly relieved when Tony said it was time to turn back.
We were greatly relieved at the news of their safe return.
